alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Washington (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 7:45AM CDT until July 26 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR CLINTON AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES IN SOUTH CENTRAL ILLINOIS... At 745 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Breese, New Baden, Carlyle, Nashville, Trenton, Aviston, Okawville, St. Rose, Germantown, Albers, Wamac, Beckemeyer, Lively Grove, Irvington, Ashley, Shattuc, Jamestown, New Memphis, Boulder and Bartelso. This includes the following State Parks... Carlyle Lake Recreational Area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Illinois between exits 34 and 61. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
